bjpack

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • bjpack.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Player() holds a Hand() object and ints for points and bet, as well as a String for the ending message, which states the win/loss/tie of that player.
    Author:
    Logan Crowe, Anthony Dowling

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player()
        Player() constructor. Sets up Hand() object, points value, bet value, and instantiates endMessage String.

      • Player

        public Player(Hand ihand)
        Player() constructor. Sets up Hand() object, points value, bet value, and instantiates endMessage String. Takes in a hand.
        Parameters:
        ihand - Hand() object to be players hand.

    • Method Detail

      • playerHit

        public final boolean playerHit()
        Logic for whether a player should hit or not. Based on standard Vegas rules.
        Returns:
        boolean true if player's hand value is either less than 17 or greater than 17, less than 20, and hand has a Ace.

      • playerBust

        public final boolean playerBust()
        Logic for whether a player had busted.
        Returns:
        boolean true if player's hand value is greater than 21.

      • blackJack

        public final boolean blackJack()
        Logic for whether a player has BlackJack(21).
        Returns:
        boolean true if player's hand value is 21.

      • printHand

        public final void printHand()
        Prints out a player's hand.

      • dealerPrintConcealed

        public final void dealerPrintConcealed()
        Prints out a player's hand with the first card hidden. Used when playing in console mode and for the dealers hand.

      • playerWin

        public final void playerWin()
        Called when a player wins. Sets points, bet and endMessage to appropriate values.

      • playerLose

        public final void playerLose()
        Called when a player losses. Sets points, bet and endMessage to appropriate values.

      • playerNatural

        public final void playerNatural()
        Called when a player wins on a 'Natural' or on the initial deal. Sets points, bet and endMessage to appropriate values.

      • playerStandOff

        public final void playerStandOff()
        Called when a player ties. Sets points, bet and endMessage to appropriate values.

      • handValue

        public final int handValue()
        Player's hand value.
        Returns:
        hand.handCount() player's hand value.

      • getHand

        public final Hand getHand()
        Player's hand.
        Returns:
        hand player's hand.

      • setHand

        public final void setHand(Hand ihand)
        Sets player's hand value.
        Parameters:
        ihand - Hand() to be the player's new hand.

        Add's a Card() object to player's hand.
        Parameters:
        icard - Card() to be added to the hand.
